reviews.review_msg: Dr. Rintoul is the best professor I've ever had he is amazing! I've taken 205 and 405 with him now, and 405 was by far my favourite class at SFU. He is funny and engaging in class, the content is extremely interesting, and his tests are consistent. I highly recommend taking any class with him, especially 405!

Gordon is an amazing professor. He explains things really well while being funny at the same time. He also tells you exactly what you do and don't need to know for the exams during lecture. Midterms were very fair and no surprises. You don't need to read the textbook to get a good grade. Highly recommend this prof and class!

Dr. Rintoul is a very caring professor for physiology. His lectures are so detailed that I can easily understand almost everything he says clearly. Also, his exams are easy as long as you put in the work and know the material. I highly recommend him for physiology related classes.

Dr. Rintoul was an amazing prof. he is super passionate about what he teaches so it makes it easy to listen to him lecture. The animal portion of this class is very dense with content but his slides simplify everything perfectly. would take his class again.
Dr. Rintoul is a very kind professor and his lectures are very engaging. The animal physiology portion of this course is pretty lecture heavy so be prepared to study a lot. Highly recommend.

Just about done the semester with Dr. Rintoul, and he has been awesome! This class is essentially an introduction to BPK 306 if you've ever taken that. You do have to study for his exams as he tests on a lot of information at once, he'll do his best to make sure you know what's important. Highly recommend!

I feel like some of the recent reviews are a bit harsh. Yes, his lectures are dense, but if you put in the effort to study (starting 6 days to a week before exams), you should be well-prepared. Flashcards are essential for this course. Gordon is also quick to respond to emails and is willing to explain concepts more than once if you're confused.

the best prof I've ever had by far. Yes his lectures are very heavy, but he explains everything super clearly and without fail, TELLS YOU what's going to be on the exam. If you stay on top of your stuff and go to class, you'll be fine. In my opinion, the recent reviews are quite harsh as this prof tells you and hints what to focus on when studying
Professor was fine. His lectures are very heavy and exams have really hard questions which dont even make sense. Overall he is fine but he just needs to make his exams easier.

really hard course. the tutorials of this course are based on a group project and no other prep for midterms and final, basically you self study. this prof also has too many slides in his lectures which makes it so hard to understand. unfortunately, he always teaches so you can't avoid him.

His lectures are very heavy. He literally has up to 75 lecture slides for a 50 min lecture. Also note that these slides are full with so much info. I hated his section of the course. the professsor teaching the plant section is slightly better in terms of lectures as he only has around 20-25 lecture slides and tests a little easier than this one.

Gordon was a great prof. He has a clear knowledge and passion for the subject and it made learning the material a lot easier. Gordon's lecture notes are quite heavy content-wise, but he is always willing to answer questions and discuss. Tutorials will require a group project, but the marking was quite lenient.
Gordon is a really great professor. This class was one of my favourites and would always set up for a great day. He speaks clearly and throws a joke in every now and then.

Gordon is a great professor, his exams are easy for a STEM class (almost too easy, don't expect a curve) and the topics covered in this course (particularly the 2nd half) are very intriguing. In addition, he has many office hour sessions leading up to exams, and will in answer any and all questions.

Gordon is the most amazing and nicest professor at SFU. He offers extra office hours and he explains everything clearly. BISC 405 was a very nicely structured course and there is not one single thing that I got bored of The lectures are video recorded. For the tutorials, you need to make a group presentation and participations matters.

Amazing above and beyond prof. Anything he talks about more than once or for longer than a couple minutes will be tested so remember that. Super clear explanations, straightforward exams with no surprises. I would take a course with him again and again. This class is content heavy but for sure do-able, Gordan makes it very enjoyable with his humour
explains the physiology and mechanisms clearly, slides are easy to follow. exam is straightforward, no surprises. TIP: use the learning objectives as study guides.

Dr. Rintoul made the lectures very clear and breaks everything down and interesting to learn. He is clear of what to expect on the midterm and final so there aren't any surprises as long as you study. Very approachable for questions and encourages them. But do study for a good mark as the course itself is very heavy but love Dr. Rintoul for a prof.
Best BISC department prof by a mile. Has great lectures and is very helpful and nice. The tests are heavy but mostly due to the large amount of material.

Dr. Rintoul is by far by favourite prof at SFU. I loved his lectures and he was the first prof to make Biology actually interesting. He is approachable and friendly, and tests were fair. I recommend anyone in a science major to take this course. Want and would totally take any class by him again!

Dr. Rintoul is such a great professor, he is always open to questions from students and is very passionate about physiology. His exams are also fairly straightforward, so if you get the chance, take this course with him!

Dr Rintoul was an amazing prof! 205 is a super content heavy course, but he made it a lot easier on us, slides are very simple to understand and he explains everything very well! Literally enjoyed taking this course with him so much, I'm taking his neurobiology course next sem!

Gordon is honestly the best. He's very passionate about neurobiology, and cares that we clearly understand concepts discussed. He has tons of office hours leading up to exams and encourages questions. Very test heavy (80% of grade), with a presentation. He covers A LOT of material, but his tests focus on concepts and mechanisms, not small details.

Gordon was an excellent professor to have during the switch to online because of Covid. He is very clear in what he expects you to know for exams. His lectures are easy to follow and the tutorial assignment was interesting. From the way he communicates, you can tell he genuinely cares about his students. Wish I couldve taken this course in person!

great prof, hosts many office hours, is very available. Midterms reflected material learned in class, made concepts clear. Not enough good things to say about Gordon. Final was a little tricky but is no way unfair. Listens well to feedback, you can tell he's there to help and wants to see success in his students.

Dr. Rintoul was fantastic, and did everything he could to make online learning as painless as possible for his students. His lectures are very clear and down to the point, and he lets you know exactly what you will be tested on. I highly recommend taking a class with him!

Gordon was a great prof because he was very clear with what he wanted you to know for the midterms and even with online classes during covid he gave us 6 additional office hours the week of each midterm which really helped for last minute questions.

Top-notch professor. The course was interesting and reasonably heavy in its content. Professor was clear and fair in what he asked on exams. Even though lectures are recorded, you feel compelled to come due to the overall atmosphere of his lectures. 10/10

Best prof ever! Doesnt want you to learn stuff you dont need to know. Super clear about whats on the exam and whats not. Doesnt lie or try to trick you. Focus on the things he spends time on as those will be on the exam!

I took him for both BISC 305 and 405. He is really nice and very approachable and even available to spend most of office hours for his students. He wants everyone to do well. He is super nice guy. You won't regret taking the courses with him!

I enjoyed this class a lot! He posted lecture recordings which were helpful because his lecture slides were mostly figures. The material is interesting to learn, especially when he talks about neurodegenerative diseases. Tutorial was separate from the lectures, we were mostly graded on a presentation. Also has extended office hours for exams!

Gord is a great prof! He's very clear about his expectations going into exams. The exams themselves were fair and it wasn't hard to do well. Gord is very approachable and helpful. He held tons of office hours, especially before exams. He seems to really care about his students and wanted them to understand the material and do well in his course.

Gord is such a straightforward lecturer. He lets you know what will be important concepts for exams and records all of his lectures so you can listen at home as well. Before the midterms and the final he had office hours every day for a week so he is very accessible for extra help.

honestly, one of the most caring profs i've ever had. really wants his students to do well and takes his time to explain concepts clearly and precisely. going to take another of his courses just because he's that good!!!
Amazing professor and very caring!

Love this proff. he may be my favorite biology proff. He will tell you whats on the exam and what you shouldnt waste you time studying, and he is extremely accesible outside of lectures and will make sure you understand everything. he genuinely cares and wants you to do well

Took the class due to his high rating, and I see why he received it. Excellent lecturer if you can pay attention in class. Studying is based on lecture slides, but they are often too poor to study from if you don't take notes in class. Huge amount of material, but little of it is on the exam, so attending class is a must to protect your grades.

Overall enjoyed this class a lot, Gordon throws a ton of material at you but he tells you what the important concepts are, and spends more time on these.  If he says something is important or it's probably going to be on the exam then it definitely is going to be on the exam.  Focus on that and you'll do fine.
Gordon is a super easy prof, listen to what he tells you know and just know that for the exam and bam you should get an easy A.

Absolutely amazing, funny, and caring professor who really goes out of his way to help you succeed in his classes. He covers a lot of material in the course but let's you know exactly which concepts he's going to test you on. Gord is also always available to answer questions outside of class and has the best office hours of any professor at sfu.

Gordon is the BEST prof hands down. Extremely considerate of students and takes into consideration that they have other exams/courses. Just show up to class and take notes! Bring a recorder in case you miss anything and you'll do fine. Exams were super fair but MC can be a little tricky. All profs should aspire to be Gordon!
Best Prof. ever!!! Prepares you well for the exams, lectures are not mandatory but extremely helpful. Notes are sufficient to study.
Awesome prof! By far my favorite class this semester. His exams aren't easy and there's alot of material but if you prepare you'll be fine. No tricks.

He was a good lecturer.  He spoke clearly and seemed fairly interested in the course material, however, it was highly favouring neurobiology because that is his field of interest.    The exams were a little tricky with some biochemical pathway multiple choice questions.  The final was great with a choice as to which questions you answered.
